alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Nash (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 23 at 4:55PM EDT until May 23 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT FOR SOUTHERN VANCE...NORTHWESTERN NASH AND FRANKLIN COUNTIES... At 455 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Kittrell to near Louisburg to near Bunn, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... Henderson, Louisburg, Franklinton, Kittrell, Bunn, Spring Hope, Castalia, Centerville, Ingleside and Aventon. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will send your report to the National Weather Service office in Raleigh.
